Tips._LCLZText: Select the body to export, set the refinement settings, then select the utility to send the mesh file to.

Description._LCLZText: The Refinement pulldown contains preconfigured mesh settings. Use the sliders under Refinement Options to customize the mesh settings.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Converts the selected body to a mesh body and outputs to STL or a 3D print utility.
Select the body to output. Set the mesh controls and specify the print utility to output to.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the body to 3D print, set the refinement settings, then select the utility to send the mesh file to.

Description._LCLZText: The Refinement pulldown contains preconfigured mesh settings. Use the sliders under Refinement Options to customize the mesh settings.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Select a mesh body to save as OBJ
Select a T-Spline body to save control frame as OBJ
Creates mechanical designs that contain mostly prismatic geometry. Access commands to create solid bodies.
Generates realistic renderings of the design.
Quick Release.
Make a quick release in a cycle asset.
Creates a solid box.
Select a plane, draw a rectangle then specify the height of the box.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane, draw a rectangle then specify the height of the box. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a solid cylinder.
Select a plane, draw a circle then specify the height of the cylinder.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane, draw a circle then specify the height of the cylinder. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a solid body sphere.
Select a plane then specify the center point of the sphere and the diameter.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane then specify the center point of the sphere and the diameter. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a solid torus.
Specify the center point and diameter of the axis of revolution of the torus.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane then draw a circle to specify the major diameter of the torus. Finish defining the coil using the manipulators or dialog box.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a solid coil.
Select a plane then draw a circle to specify the major diameter of the coil. Finish defining the coil using the manipulators or dialog box.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane then draw a circle to specify the major diameter of the coil. Finish defining the coil using the manipulators or dialog box. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a solid pipe that follows a selected path.
Select the path then specify the section and size.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the path then specify the section and size. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Adds depth to a closed sketch profile or planar face.
Select the profile or planar face then specify the distance to extrude.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the profile or planar face then specify the distance to extrude. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

Description._LCLZText: After selecting the profile, you can select faces or points to set the distance value. In parametric modeling, Set Extents to To to maintain an association with selected faces or points.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Revolves a sketch profile or planar face around a selected axis.
Select a profile or planar face then select the axis to revolve around.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a profile or planar face then select the axis to revolve around. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

Description._LCLZText: After selecting the profile and axis, you can select faces or points to set the angular value.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Sweeps a sketch profile or planar face along a selected path.
Select a series of profiles or planar faces to define a shape. Optionally select rails or a centerline to guide the shape.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a series of profiles or planar faces to define a shape. Optionally select rails or a centerline to guide the shape.

Description._LCLZText: The distance for the sweep is a decimal percentage of the length of the path.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a transitional shape between two or more sketch profiles or planar faces.
Select a series of profiles or planar faces to define a shape. Optionally select rails or a centerline to guide the shape.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a series of profiles or planar faces to define a shape. Optionally select rails or a centerline to guide the shape.

Description._LCLZText: Change the continuity from Free to Direction, Tangent or Smooth to refine the loft. Double-click on mapping point manipulators to drag all mapping points for a profile.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a transitional shape between two or more sketch profiles or planar faces.
Select at least two profiles to define the loft. Refine the shape by using rail or centerline guides or point mapping.

Tips._LCLZText: Select at least two profiles to define the loft. Refine the shape by using rail or centerline guides or point mapping.

Description._LCLZText: Changing the continuity from Free to Direction impacts the influence of the corresponding profile across the loft. Set the Spacing setting to Curvature to add faces in areas of higher curvature.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates obstacle geometry bodies in locations of bolts or pins in an assembly.
Customize the size and shape of connector obstacles by adjusting the shaft length and diameter, and clearance for bolt heads, nuts, and tooling.

Tips._LCLZText: On the canvas, select the start and end of the shaft. Select edges or faces. Use manipulators to adjust the shaft diameter and length. To add clearance for bolt heads, select Bolt Head and specify the head diameter and length. To add clearance for a tool, select Tool Clearance and specify the clearance diameter and length.

Description._LCLZText: Select Flip Side to change ends of bolts and tool clearance.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Uses an open sketch curve to create a thin feature. The rib is created planar (parallel) to the sketch plane.
Select a curve then specify the thickness.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a curve then specify the thickness. The rib is added planar (parallel) to the sketch plane.

Description._LCLZText: Change the Depth Option from To Next to Depth to give the rib a custom depth distance.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Uses an open sketch curve to create a thin feature. The web is created normal (perpendicular) to the sketch plane.
Select the curve then specify the thickness.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a curve then specify the thickness. The web is added normal (perpendicular) to the sketch plane.

Description._LCLZText: Change the Depth Option from To Next to Depth to give the web a custom depth distance.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a hole based on user-specified values and selections.
Select a face to place the hole then select edges to position the hole on the face, or select sketch points to place multiple holes. Specify the hole type, tap type and size values.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face to place the hole then select edges to position the hole on the face, or select sketch points to place multiple holes. Specify the hole type, tap type and size values.

Description._LCLZText: Select the center point of the hole to change the position. When creating tapped or standard clearance holes, the diameter is driven by the Size selected in the Use Standards section.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Add internal or external threads to cylindrical geometry. Threads can be cosmetic or modeled on the geometry.
Select a cylindrical face then set the thread specifications.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a cylindrical face then set the thread specifications.

Description._LCLZText: If necessary, the selected feature is resized to match the selected thread size.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Quickly arrange items on a plane or sketch for manufacturing.
Creates duplicate faces, features, bodies, or components and arranges them in rows and columns.
Select the objects to pattern then specify the direction, quantity, and distance.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the object to pattern then specify the direction, quantity and distance.

Description._LCLZText:
Set Distance Type to Extent to specify the total distance of the pattern. Set the Distance Type to Spacing to specify the distance between objects.

When patterning features, use Optimzed compute where possible to improve performance.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates duplicate faces, features, bodies, or components and arranges them in an arc or circular pattern.
Select the objects to pattern, the axis to revolve around, and the quantity.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the object to pattern, the axis to revolve around, and the quantity.

Description._LCLZText: When patterning features, use Optimzed compute where possible to improve performance.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates duplicate faces, features, bodies, or components and arranges them along a path.
Select the objects to pattern and the path to pattern along. Specify the distance and quantity.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the object to pattern and the path to pattern along. Specify the distance and quantity.

Description._LCLZText:
Set Distance Type to Extent to specify the total distance of the pattern. Set the Distance Type to Spacing to specify the distance between objects.

When patterning features in a parametric design, use Optimzed compute where possible to improve performance.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Makes a mirrored copy of selected faces, features, bodies, or components at equal distances across a plane.
Select the objects to mirror then the plane to mirror around.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the objects to mirror then the plane to mirror around.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Adds thickness to surface faces to make a solid.
Select the faces to thicken then specify a thickness value.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the faces to thicken then specify a thickness value.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates, joins or removes volumes using bounding volumes formed by tool selections.
Select solids, surfaces or workplanes as tools to form volumes (or cells). These cells can be used to cut existing solids or to join to existing solids or to create a new solid.

Tips._LCLZText: Select solids, surfaces or workplanes as tools to form volumes (or cells). These cells can be used to cut existing solids or to join to existing solids or to create a new solid.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Identifies features in a body. Recognized features are listed in the browser.
Select the bodies then specify the feature types to identify.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the bodies then specify the feature types to identify.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates the surrounding volume from selected bodies. Surrounding volume can be internal or external to the bodies. The surrounding volume is created in a new component.
Select solid bodies, capping surfaces, or work planes as tools to form the surrounding volume.

Tips._LCLZText: Select solid bodies, capping surfaces, or work planes as tools to form the surrounding volume. Select the external shape then set the offset.

Description._LCLZText: A new component is created and the new bodies are added to that component.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Enters Form mode and inserts a form feature into the timeline. Use form tools to create and edit history-free bodies by pushing and pulling on vertices, edges, and faces. This is commonly referred to as T-Spline modeling.
Select Finish Form to exit out of the mode.
Return to the Model workspace.
Enters direct editing mode and inserts a history-free feature in the timeline. Actions performed while in the Base Feature are not recorded in the timeline.
Select Finish Base Feature to exit out of the mode.
Creates a new empty component or converts existing bodies to components.
When creating an empty component, enter a name and select the parent. When converting bodies, select the bodies to convert.

Tips._LCLZText: When creating an empty component, enter a name and select the parent. When converting bodies, select the bodies to convert.

Description._LCLZText: To create subassemblies, create an empty component then drag components into it.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Return to the Model workspace.
Creates a surface body box.
Select a plane, draw a rectangle then specify the height of the box.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane, draw a rectangle then specify the height of the box. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a surface body cylinder.
Select a plane, draw a circle then specify the height of the cylinder.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane, draw a circle then specify the height of the cylinder. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a surface sphere.
Select a plane then specify the center point of the sphere and the diameter.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane then specify the center point of the sphere and the diameter. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a surface torus.
Specify the center point and diameter of the axis of revolution of the torus.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane then draw a circle to specify the major diameter of the torus. Finish defining the coil using the manipulators or dialog box.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a surface coil.
Select a plane then draw a circle to specify the major diameter of the coil. Finish defining the coil using the manipulators or dialog box.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane then draw a circle to specify the major diameter of the coil. Finish defining the coil using the manipulators or dialog box. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a surface pipe that follows a selected path.
Select the path then specify the section and size.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the path then specify the section and size. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Adds depth to a sketch profile or planar face.
Select the profile or planar face then specify the distance to extrude.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the profile or planar face then specify the distance to extrude. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

Description._LCLZText: After selecting the profile, you can select faces or points to set the distance value. In parametric modeling, Set Extents to To to maintain an association with selected faces or points.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a transitional shape between two or more sketch profiles or planar faces.
Select a series of profiles or planar faces to define a shape. Optionally select rails or a centerline to guide the shape.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a series of profiles or planar faces to define a shape. Optionally select rails or a centerline to guide the shape.

Description._LCLZText: Change the continuity from Free to Direction, Tangent or Smooth to refine the loft. Double-click on mapping point manipulators to drag all mapping points for a profile.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Modifies the selected geometry using offset, extrude, or fillet commands. The operation depends on the geometry selected.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face, edge or profile to modify. Press Pull can be used to offset a face, fillet an edge or extrude a sketch profile.

Description._LCLZText: In a parametric design, use the Offset Type options to modify existing features or to create new features.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Converts the selected face to T-Spline faces, edges, and vertices for modification.
Select the face to modify. Increase the length and width factors to add faces to give more control.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the face to modify. Increase the length and width factors to add faces to give more control.

Description._LCLZText: Use Coordinate Space to control the position of the manipulator. Use Selection Filter to control the types of objects available for selection.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Adds fillets or rounds to one or more edges, faces or features.
Select edges, faces or features and then specify a radius. Use the Rule Fillet type to add fillets based on specified rules.

Tips._LCLZText: Select edges, faces or features and then specify a radius. The fillet will be applied to all edges of the face or feature. Variable fillet will work only on edges. Rule Fillet will work on faces and features only.

Description._LCLZText:
For creating fillets, you may select a single or multiple group of edges, faces or features and specify a radius.

For creating rule fillets between intersection of faces or features, choose ‘Between Faces / Features’ option from Rule menu. Then select 2 sets of faces or features to create desired fillets between the common faces or features.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Applies a bevel to one or more edges.
Select the edges then specify a distance.

Tips._LCLZText: Select edges then specify a distance.

Description._LCLZText: Use window select to select all the edges to chamfer. Change the Chamfer Type to change the input types.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Removes material from a part interior, creating a hollow cavity with walls of a specified thickness.
Select faces then specify a thickness. The selected faces will be removed and the body will become hollow.

Tips._LCLZText: Select faces then specify a thickness. The selected faces will be removed and the body will become hollow.

Description._LCLZText:
Select the body in the browser to create a hollow body without removing faces.

Hold Shift (Windows) or Command (Mac) to select multiple faces to remove.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Applies a draft angle to specified planar faces.
Select a plane or planar face for the neutral plane then select the faces to be drafted. Specify the draft angle for the faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane or planar face for the neutral plane then select the faces to be drafted. Specify the draft angle for the faces.

Description._LCLZText: The plane you select sets the direction of the draft. Faces being drafted cannot be parallel to the plane.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Scales sketch objects, bodies, or components.
Select the objects to scale then specify the scale factor.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the objects to scale and the point from which to scale, then specify the scale factor.

Description._LCLZText: Change the Scale Type to Non Uniform to input different scale factors in the X, Y, and Z directions.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Performs boolean operations between solid bodies.
Select the target body then select one or more tool bodies to perform a join, cut, or intersect operation on the target.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the target body then select one or more tool bodies to perform a join, cut, or intersect operation on the target.

Description._LCLZText: Use Keep Tools to keep the tool bodies in the design. The result of the combine command may be hidden behind the tool bodies.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Shifts the selected face or faces in a positive or negative direction.
Select a single face or multiple faces and specify the Offset distance.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a single face or multiple faces and specify the Offset distance.

Description._LCLZText: Adjoining curved tangent Faces will Offset when geometrically possible.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Replaces one or more part faces with different face. The new face must completely intersect the part.
Select the face to remove then select the new face.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the faces to remove (Source Faces) then select the new faces (Target Faces).

Description._LCLZText: The target faces must completely enclose the source faces.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Divides faces using a selected profile, face, or plane as the cutting tool.
Select the faces to modify then select the profile, face, or plane that divides the source face.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the faces to modify then select the profile, face, or plane that divides the source faces.

Description._LCLZText: Use a sketch curve, construction plane, or the origin plane as your Splitting Tool.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates new bodies by dividing selected bodies using a profile, face, or plane.
Select the bodies to modify then select the profile, face, or plane that divides the bodies.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the bodies to modify then select the profile, face, or plane that divides the bodies.

Description._LCLZText: Use a sketch curve, construction plane, origin plane as the Splitting Tool.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Splits a body using surfaces generated from its silhouette curves.
Set the view direction by selecting a plane or axis then select the body and choose a split operation.

Tips._LCLZText: Set the view direction by selecting a plane or axis then select the body and choose a split operation.

Description._LCLZText: Silhouette Split works best with shelled bodies.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Moves the selected face, body, sketch, or construction geometry a specified distance or angle.
Select the objects to modify then specify the distance or angle. Use Set Pivot to reposition the manipulator.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the object to modify then specify the distance or angle. Use Set Pivot to reposition the manipulator.

Description._LCLZText: Change Transform to Point to Point to move the objects by selecting from and to points rather than entering distances. Check Create Copy option to create a copy of the entity during the move.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Moves an object (component, body, sketch, work geometry) by aligning geometry selected from the object with geometry selected elsewhere. Geometry can be a point, line, plane, circle, or coordinate system. Snaps are treated as full coordinate systems for full position and orientation alignment.
Select the point on the object to move then select the point on the face to align to. Click Flip and Angle to rotate the object.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the point on the object to move then select the point on the face to align to. Click Flip and Angle to rotate the object.

Description._LCLZText: Hold Shift to disable snapping. Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Command (Mac) to lock snaps on a face.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Physical materials affect the color and engineering properties of bodies and components.
Drag the physical material from the dialog to the body or component.

Tips._LCLZText: Drag the physical material from the dialog to the body or component.

Description._LCLZText: Right-click the material swatch in the In This Design section to edit, duplicate, and access other options.

TextBlock._LCLZText: The appearance affects the color of bodies, components, and faces. Appearances override the color assigned from the physical material. Appearances do not affect engineering properties.
Drag the appearance from the dialog to the body, component, or face.

Tips._LCLZText: Drag the appearance from the dialog to the body, component, or face.

Description._LCLZText: Right-click the appearance swatch in the In This Design section to edit, duplicate, and access other options.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Deletes the selected entity from the design.
Select components, bodies, sketches, and construction entities to remove.
Computes all parameters in the design.
Displays the Parameters dialog box.
Edit the name, expression, and comments for parameters. Create User Parameters to use in other expressions.
Paste Command
Makes a surface larger by extending a specified distance.
Select the edge of the surface to extend and specify the distance. The extension type controls the direction of the new surface.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the edge of the surface to extend and specify the distance. The extension type controls the direction of the new surface.

Description._LCLZText: Set the Extend Type to Perpendicular to extend the surface 90 degrees from its original angle.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Positions components relative to one another and defines the relative motion. Components maintain their current position.
Select components to join. Specify the joint type and the position of the joint origin.

Tips._LCLZText: Select two components, specify a joint type. If the joint type allows motion, select a center position for that motion.

Description._LCLZText: Click Animate to show the allowed motion by animating Component1. Click again to stop the animation.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Positions components relative to one another and defines the relative motion.
Select geometry or joint origins to define the joint. Specify the type to define the relative motion.

Tips._LCLZText:
Select a Joint Origin mode from the Position tab.
Select a Joint Origin for Component 1, then for Component 2.
Select a Joint type from the Motion tab to limit degrees of freedom.
Use the Animate feature to preview the motion.

Description._LCLZText:
Component 1 moves in relation to Component 2, which remains fixed.
Select a face or edge to limit Joint Origin selection to points on that face or edge.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Positions a joint origin on a component. Joint origins define the geometry used to relate a joint's components.
Select geometry to define the joint origin.

Tips._LCLZText:
Choose from 3 Joint Origin modes.
Simple: create a Joint Origin on a face or edge.
Between Two Faces: center a Joint Origin between two faces.
Two Edge Intersection: create a Joint Origin at the apparent intersection of two edges.
Use Joint Origin with Joint to define motion between components.

Description._LCLZText:
Select Joint Origin mode, select geometry, and snap the Joint Origin into position.
Adjust Alignment settings like Angle, Offset, and Flip to set the orientation of the Joint Origin.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Locks the relative position of the selected components. The components are treated as a single object when moved or when joints are applied.
Select the components to group together.

Tips._LCLZText: Select components to be grouped.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Specify the rotation angle or distance value for joint degrees of freedom.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a joint, then used the manipulators or the dialog to modify joint values.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Defines rotational and translational relationship between joint degrees of freedom.
Select the joints then specify the values.

Tips._LCLZText: Select two joints then specify their relative motion.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Activates contact analysis between components in contact sets. Contact sets are managed in the browser.
Turns off contact analysis for all component.
Activates contact analysis for all components.
Creates a contact set between selected components.
Select the bodies or components to participate in the contact analysis.
Performs kinematic motion analysis based on joints.
Select the joints to participate then specify points and values for the motion.
Inserts the selected component into the current design.
Select the component to insert then use the manipulator to adjust the position.

Use Sketch mode to create basic geometry profiles that define the design. First select a construction plane. Then create lines, arcs, or points and use dimensions to constrain the boundaries. Sketches are used with 3D creation commands such as Extrude.
After creating the boundary, select Finish Sketch to exit Sketch mode.
Show/Hide sketch panel.
Creates lines and arcs.
Select a start and endpoint to define a line segment. Click and drag the endpoint of a segment to define an arc.
Creates a spline through the selected fit points.
Select the first point to start the spline. Select additional points as fit points.
Creates a spline driven by the selected control points.
Select the first point to start the spline. Select additional points as control points.
Creates a spline driven by the selected control points.
Select the first point to start the spline. Select additional points as control points.
Recommended for use in the Sculpt workspace
Recommended for general modeling workflows
Creates a sketch point.
Creates a circle using a center point and diameter.
Select to define the center point then specify the diameter.
Creates a circle defined by two points.
Specify two points on the diameter of the circle.
Creates a circle defined by three points.
Specify three points on the circumference of the circle. The points define the size and position of the circle.
Creates a circle tangent to two sketch lines.
Select two lines then specify the radius of the circle.
Creates a circle tangent to three sketch lines.
Select three lines that the circle will be tangent to.
Creates an arc using three points.
Select the start point, end point, and then a point on the arc.
Creates an arc using three points.
Select the center point, then select start point and last select the end point or specify an angle value.
Creates an arc with tangency.
Select two points.
Creates a rectangle using two points for the diagonal corners.
Select the first point as the start of the rectangle. Select the second point or specify the width and height values.
Creates a rectangle using three points to define width, direction, and height.
Select the first point as the start of the rectangle. Select a second point or specify a distance value and pick a point. Select a third point or specify a distance value.
Creates a rectangle using two points to define the center and one corner.
Select the first point as the center of the rectangle. Select a corner point or specify width and height values.
Creates an ellipse defined by a center point, major axis and a point on the ellipse.
Select the center point of the ellipse. Select the second point to define the first axis. Select the third point to define a point on the ellipse.
Creates a polygon using the center point and the midpoint of one edge.
Select the center point of the polygon. Specify a value for the number of sides. Select the midpoint of an edge or specify a distance and select a point.
Creates a polygon using the center point and a vertex.
Select the center point of the polygon. Specify a value for the number of edges. Select a vertex point or specify a distance and select a point.
Creates a polygon by defining a single edge and the position of the polygon.
Select the start and end points of one edge or select the start point then specify a distance and angle. Specify the number of sides. Select a point to define the orientation of the polygon.
Creates a linear slot defined by placement and distance of slot arc centers, and by slot width.
Specify centers of both slot arcs. Click to specify slot width, or enter diameter of the slot arcs.
Creates a linear slot defined by orientation, length and width.
Specify the start and end on the slot center line. Click to specify slot width, or enter diameter of the slot arcs.
Creates a linear slot defined by a center point, location of slot arc centers, and by slot width.
Specify the slot center, and place center of a slot arc. Click to specify slot width, or enter diameter of the slot arcs.
Creates an arc slot defined by a three point center arc and slot width.

Specify the start and end point of the slot center arc. Specify the third point of the center arc, or enter center arc radius. Click to specify slot width, or enter diameter or radius of the slot arcs.
Creates an arc slot defined by a center point, two point center arc and slot width.
Specify the center point of the slot. Specify the start and end point of the slot center arc. Click to specify slot width or enter diameter or radius of the slot arc.
Creates a curve driven by endpoints and Rho value. Depending on the Rho value, the curve can be elliptical, parabolic, or hyperbolic.
Select the start point, end point, and then the top of the vertex. Use the guidelines to create a tangency constraint. Specify the Rho value for the desired shape of the conic curve.
Inserts text into the active sketch. Use text as a profile to create 3D geometry.
Select the insertion point and input the text. Modify the format of the text in the Text dialog box.

Tips._LCLZText: Place the first point to position the text. Click the Text field to begin typing the desired text. Rotate the manipulator to the left to change the angle of the text.

Description._LCLZText: The text box can be dimensioned and constrained.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Places an arc of a specified radius at the intersection of two lines or arcs.
Select the vertex or the two lines or arcs. Specify a radius for the fillet.
Trims a sketch curve to the nearest intersecting curve or boundary geometry.
Pause the cursor over the curve to preview the portion to be trimmed. Select the curve to trim.
Extends a curve to the nearest intersecting curve or boundary geometry.
Pause the cursor over the curve to preview the portion to be extended. Select the curve to extend it.
Breaks a sketch entity into two or more segments where it intersects other sketch entities.
Pause the cursor over the sketch entity to preview where it will be broken, then click to break it.
Scales sketch geometry.
Select sketch geometry to scale then specify the scale factor.
Copies the selected sketch curves a specified distance from the original curves.
Select the curves to offset then specify the offset distance.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the curves to offset then enter an offset distance or drag the manipulator.

Description._LCLZText: The size and position of the new geometry is associated to the original geometry. To remove this association, select the offset glyph in the canvas then right-click and select Delete.

TextBlock._LCLZText: EDIT : Copies the selected sketch curves a specified distance from the original curves.
EDIT : Select the curves to offset then specify the offset distance.

Tips._LCLZText: EDIT : Select the curves to offset then enter an offset distance or drag the manipulator.

Description._LCLZText: EDIT : The size and position of the new geometry is associated to the original geometry. To remove this association, select the offset glyph in the canvas then right-click and select Delete.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Mirrors the selected sketch curves about a selected sketch line.
Select the curves to mirror then select the line to mirror about.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the sketch curves to mirror then select the line to mirror around. The mirror line must be a line in the active sketch.

Description._LCLZText: The mirror command also also adds a mirror symmetry constraint to the geometry.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Duplicates selected sketch curves in an arc or circular pattern.
Select the curves to pattern, the point to revolve around, and the quantity.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the curves to pattern then select the center point.

Description._LCLZText: A pattern glyph is placed at the center of the pattern. Double-click the glyph to edit the pattern.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Duplicates sketch curves in rows and columns.
Select the curves to pattern then specify the direction, quantity, and distance.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the curves to pattern then select the directions if they are not horizontal and vertical.

Description._LCLZText:
A pattern glyph is placed at the center of the pattern. Double-click the glyph to edit the pattern.

Set Distance Type to Extent to specify the total distance of the pattern. Set the Distance Type to Spacing to specify the distance between objects.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Projects edges, work geometry, and sketch curves into the current sketch.
Select the objects to project.
Projects the body silhouette, edges, work geometries and sketch curves into the active sketch plane.
Use the selection filter to project specific type of geometry or the body silhouette.

Tips._LCLZText: Set the selection filter then select the objects to project into the sketch.

Description._LCLZText: In the selection filter Specified Entities will project points, lines, arcs, etc. Bodies will project the entire silhoutte of the object selected.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Projects the points, model edges, work geometries, and sketch curves that intersect the active sketch plane.
Use the selection filter to project specific type of geometry or the entire model.

Tips._LCLZText: Set the selection filter then select the objects to project the intersection of the object and the active sketch.

Description._LCLZText: In the selection filter Specified Entities will find the intersection of points, lines, arcs, etc. Bodies will project the entire intersection cut of the object selected.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Projects the model edges that intersect the active sketch plane.
Projects the body silhouette onto the active sketch plane.
Project sketch geometry, edge, vertex, or workpoint to selected faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the face to project on to then select the sketch curves to project.

Description._LCLZText: Start a new sketch to contain the projected geometry.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Include edges, work geometry, and sketch curves into the current sketch.
Select the objects to include.
Creates a 3D sketch curve from intersecting geometry.
The first selection is the sketch curve. The second selection is the sketch curve or faces to intersect with. You can select multiple curves or faces to intersect with.

Tips._LCLZText: The first selection is the sketch curve. The second selection is the sketch curve or faces to intersect with. You can select multiple curves or faces to intersect with.

Description._LCLZText: The projected curve and the selected sketch curve cannot be in the same sketch.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Create sketch dimensions for sketch geometries. Use dimensions to control the size or position of sketch objects.
Select the sketch curves to dimension then select an area to position the dimension.
Constraints dictate the position of geometry relative to other sketch geometries.
Constrains the position of two points or a point and a line or curve together.
This could be a point constrained along a line, two points constrainted to each other, or a point constrained along a curve.
Constrains two or more objects so that they share a common line.
This could be a line and a rectangle, where the line and one edge of the rectangle lie along the same line.
Constrains two or more arcs, circles, or ellipses to the same center point.
Constrains a point or object to the midpoint of another object.
Locks the size and location of a point or object.
Constrains two lines so that they extend in the same direction and never intersect.
Constrains two objects so that they lie perpendicular (at a 90-degree angle) to each other.
Constrains a single line, or two points, to lie on either the vertical or horizontal axis, whichever is closer to the current alignment.
Constrains a curve and another object so that they touch at a single point but never cross each other.
Constrains similar objects so that their sizes are identical. When the size of one object changes, the others adjust, too.
Constrains two or more objects so that they are symmetrical (identical to each other in relation to a common axis).
Constrains two or more objects to create a smooth, continuous curvature between them (G2 continuity).
Moves the selected sketch curve. Curves can be moved off the sketch plane to create a 3D sketch.
Select the curves to move then specify the new location.
Export active sketch to DXF. Export sketch geometries to DXF file, such as: point, line, circle, arc, ellipse and spline.
Exits the edit sketch state.
Creates a construction plane that is offset from the selected face or plane.
Select a face, plane, or sketch profile, then specify the offset distance.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face, plane, or sketch profile then specify the offset distance.

Description._LCLZText: In a parametric model, edit the plane in the timeline to change the position. In a direct model, use the Move command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction plane through an edge, axis, or line at a specified angle.
Select a linear edge, axis, or sketch line to position the plane, then specify the rotation angle.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a linear edge, axis, or sketch line to position the plane, then specify the rotation angle.

Description._LCLZText: In a parametric model, edit the plane in the timeline to change the position. In a direct model, use the Move command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction plane that is tangent to a cylindrical or conical face.
Select the cylinder or cone that the plane will be tangent to. Specify the position by entering an angle or selecting a reference plane and then adding an angle.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the cylinder or cone that the plane will be tangent to. Specify the position by entering an angle or selecting a face to snap to.

Description._LCLZText: In a parametric model, edit the plane in the timeline to change the position. In a direct model, use the Move command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction plane at the midpoint between two faces or work planes.
Select two faces or planes.
Creates a construction plane passing through two linear edges or axes.
Select two edges or axes. The edges or axes must be coplanar.
Creates a construction plane through three selected construction points, sketch points or vertices.
Select three points.
Creates a construction plane tangent to a face and aligned to a point.
Select a face then a point or vertex.
Create a construction plane normal to an edge or sketch profile.
Select the path then specify the position of the plane along the path.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the path then specify the position of the plane along the path.

Description._LCLZText: In a parametric model, edit the plane in the timeline to change the position. In a direct model, use the Move command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction axis coincident with the center axis of a cylindrical or conical face.
Select a cylinder or cone.
Creates a construction line normal to the selected face at the area selected.
Select a face at the desired area.
Creates a construction line coincident with the intersection of two planes or planar faces.
Select two planes or planar faces.

Title._LCLZText: Work axis through two planes Information

Tips._LCLZText: Select two planes or planar faces.

Description._LCLZText: In a parametric model, edit the axis in the timeline to change the position. In a direct model, use the Move command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction line through two selected work points, sketch points or vertices.
Select two work points, sketch points or vertices.
Creates a construction line from selected linear edge or sketch curve.
Select an edge or sketch curve.
Creates a construction line normal to the selected face and passing through the selected point.
Select a face or sketch profile then select a point.
Creates a construction point at a selected point or vertex.
Select a point or vertex.
Creates a construction point at the intersection of two linear edges or sketch lines.
Select two linear edges or sketch lines.
Creates a construction point at the intersection of three planes or planar faces.
Select three planes or planar faces.
Creates a construction point at the center of a sphere or circular edge.
Select a circular edge or spherical face.
Creates a construction point at the intersection of a construction plane, planar face, or sketch profile and an axis or sketch line.
Select a plane, planar face, or sketch profile and an axis or sketch line.
Create a construction point at an edge or sketch profile.
Select the path then specify the position of the point along the path.
Reports distance, angle, area, or position data of the selected object.
Select a vertex, edge, face, body, or component.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the geometry to measure. The results reported are determined by the type of geometry selected. The measurement is the minimum distance between the two selections.

Description._LCLZText: Click a value in the dialog to copy the value to the clipboard.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Reports the interference between selected solid bodies or components.
Select the components then click compute. Choose to create components from the interferences.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the components then click Compute to display results.

Description._LCLZText: Check Show All Interferences to highlight the geometry that has interferences in the model. Uncheck Show All Intereferences then select individual rows to display that interference.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Shows the amount of curvature at sample points along the selected edges.
Select the edges to evaluate then set the comb density and scale.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the edges to evaluate then set the comb density and scale.

Description._LCLZText: This command is only for edges of bodies. To display a curvature comb on a sketch curve, right-click the curve and select Toggle Curvature Display.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Displays a stripe pattern on the selected bodies. Use Zebra Analysis to determine continuity.
Select the surfaces then set the analysis options.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the bodies then set the analysis options. Jagged stripes will indicate breaks in curvature.

Description._LCLZText: Change the direction of the stripes to get evaluate different curves.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Displays a color gradient on the faces of selected bodies to help evaluate the manufacturability of your design.
Select the bodies to evaluate and the axis to define the direction. Use the options to refine the gradient display.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the bodies to evaluate and the axis to define the direction. Use the options to refine the gradient display.

Description._LCLZText: Use draft analysis to evaluate positions for a parting line or to find areas of zero draft or undercuts.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Displays a color gradient on the faces of selected bodies to help evaluate areas of high and low surface curvature.
Select the bodies to evaluate. Use the options to refine the color gradient display.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the bodies to evaluate. Use the options to refine the color gradient display.

Description._LCLZText: High curvature areas will display hotter colors, whereas low curvature areas will display cooler colors.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Accessibility Analysis
Used to colorize an object based on whether or not certain parts of the object are accessible from a particular plane.
Inaccessible areas are highlighted in red. Useful for checking undercut areas through a plane.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the bodies to evaluate and then set the analysis options.

Description._LCLZText: Regions that are accessibile will be highlighted green. Regions that are not accessible will be highlighted red.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Minimum Radius Analysis
Displays colors on the model that represent the minimum radius for the curvature of the concave faces.
Detect the minimum fit for holes and fillets. Useful for determining tool sizes in machining.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the bodies to evaluate. Use the options to refine the minimum radius.

Description._LCLZText: Regions with a higher curvature than the minimum radius will be highlighted in red.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Section Analysis
Generates a cut away view of the models through a face or a plane.
Select a face or plane and drag the arrow to section the part. Use the manipulators to rotate the selected plane.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face or plane to use as the cutting plane. Specify offset and angle values by dragging the manipulators.

Description._LCLZText: Use section analysis to generate a cutaway view of a model from the selected plane.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Center of Mass
Displays a center mark glyph at the center of mass for the selected objects.
You can measure from the center mark to other objects.

Tips._LCLZText: Select components and bodies to include. The center of mass is displayed after you click OK.

Description._LCLZText: The COM calculation can add to calculation time for other commands. Turn off the visibility of the center of mass node in the browser to exclude it from other calculations. The COM will be recalculated when the visibility is toggled on.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Applies different colors to each component to help differentiate between components.
Click the command to toggle this setting on or off.
Places an image on a selected face.
Select a face then select an image to import.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face then select an image to import. Use PNGs to retain background transparency.

Description._LCLZText: Use the manipulators to move, scale, rotate, and flip the image. Selecting Chain Faces will allow you to span the image across multiple faces.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Places an image on a planar face or sketch plane.
Select a face then select an image to import.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face or plane then select an image to import. Select display through to see the image through the model and use as a reference.

Description._LCLZText: Right click on the canvas image in the browser and select the Calibrate tool to set a specific distance between two points. This will resize the image based on that distance.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Places an image in the 3D space. The image will be placed in the center of current view and is oriented relative to the active camera.
Select an image to import then position and scale the image.

Tips._LCLZText: Select an image to import then position and scale the image. Select display through to see the image through the model and use as a reference.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Imports a SVG file into the active sketch. Use SVG files for detailed sketches such as logos or text.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the sketch profile or planar face then select the SVG file to insert. Set the position and the scale.

Description._LCLZText: SVG files are inserted as fixed sketch entities in the active design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Imports a DXF file into the active sketch.
Select a face or plane then select the DXF file to insert. Set the position of the geometry on the selected plane.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face or plane then select the DXF file to insert. Set the position of the geometry on the selected plane.

Description._LCLZText: Single Sketch mode inserts the DXF geometry into a single sketch. One Sketch per Layer mode creates a separate sketch for each DXF layer. Both modes only insert sketch geometry - solid and surface geometry is not inserted.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Insert a McMaster-Carr Component into the active document.
Browse to the desired component, click the Product Detail CAD icon, select the file type, then click Save.

Tips._LCLZText: Browse to the desired component, click the Product Detail CAD icon, select the file type, then click Save.

Description._LCLZText: SAT and STEP files are supported. The selected component is added to the active design as a new component.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Scripts and Add-Ins
Manage Scripts and Add-Ins
Displays the Scripts and Add-Ins dialog box. Create, edit, run, stop, debug and manage Scripts and Add-Ins.
The active Selection Mode displays here.
Selection is always active.
Hold down the Ctrl (Windows) / Cmd (Mac) key to select multiple objects.
Click and drag from left to right to select all objects that are entirely enclosed by the window (window selection).
Click and drag from right to left to select all objects that are crossed by the window (crossing selection).
Note: Use Selection Filters to include or exclude items.
Click and drag to create a selection boundary with an irregular shape.
Click and drag from left to right to select all objects that are entirely enclosed by the window (window selection).
Click and drag from right to left to select all objects that are crossed by the window (crossing selection).
Note: Use Selection Filters to include or exclude items.
Press and hold the left mouse button and move across objects to select them.
Note: Use Selection Filters to include or exclude items.
Invert the active selection by obeying the options of Selection Tools and Selection Filters.
Enables or disables the movement of components by dragging in the canvas.
Hold the Alt key to drag components when Component Drag is disabled.
Set the environment and lighting for the scene. This setting only affects the Rendering workspace.

Tips._LCLZText: Set the environment and lighting for the scene. This settings only affects the Rendering workspace.

Description._LCLZText: Open the Environment Library tab to apply a pre-configured lighting setup, download new environments from the cloud, or attach a custom HDR environment. Brightness adjusts the lighting intensity, and Rotation adjusts the location of lights and shadows.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Sets the orientation of the texture applied to the body or component.
Select the object to modify then the Projection Type and the Axis. Modify the Mapping Transform using the manipulator or fields in the dialog.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the object to modify then the Projection Type and the Axis. Modify the Mapping Transform usimg the manipulator or fields in the dialog.

Description._LCLZText: Use Projection Type to control how the texture is wrapped onto the body or component. Use the Mapping Transform to control the position of the texture.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Deletes selected faces.
Select faces to remove. Neighboring faces are automatically deleted, as appropriate, in order to heal the model.

Tips._LCLZText: This will delete a group of faces and use the surrounding faces to maintain a valid 3D body.

Description._LCLZText: If the desired effect is not achieved undo and select additional surfaces or less surfaces and try the command or try manual selection and the delete key.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Automatically deletes features from selected objects.
Select objects, from which to delete features, and choose appropriate settings. Associated features are selected and deleted accordingly.

Tips._LCLZText: This tool allows the fast removal of simple features like chamfers, and small holes.

Description._LCLZText: Set the tolerance and look at the highlighted features that will be removed. If a valid body can't be obtained after removal try adjusting the tolerance with the slider.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Selects surfaces by defining a seed surface and a boundary
Use the dialog controls for selects a seed surface and one or more bounds for the selection that define the boundary of the selection

Title._LCLZText: Seed and Boundary Tips and Tricks

Description._LCLZText:
Use the dialog controls for selects a seed surface and one or more bounds for the selection that define the boundary of the selection.
Seed and Boundary Selection works on one part at a time. Consider all possible paths between the Boundaries and the Seed. If there are holes between the inside and outside of your part, then both internal and external faces may get selected, so you need to add the holes to the Boundary selections.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Sets selection priority to faces.
Click to select only faces in the model. Click again to remove priority and allow selection of all objects.
Sets selection priority to bodies.
Click to select only bodies in the model. Click again to remove priority and allow selection of all objects.
Sets selection priority to edges.
Click to select only edges in the model. Click again to remove priority and allow selection of all objects.
Selects faces adjacent to the selected object.
Selects objects by name.
Enter the object name and set the type. Find the object and select if appropriate.
Selects objects based on size.
Use the slider bars or directly input minimum and maximum size values to select objects.
Selects objects defined by boundaries.
Set the centroid, shape, and shape direction of the boundary. Specify if objects are selected within the boundary and if they can intersect the boundary.
Replaces selected objects with primitive shapes.
Choose appropriate objects and define the replacement shape. The default primitive shape bounds all selected objects and the original objects are suppressed.

Tips._LCLZText: Replaces selected objects with primitive shapes (Box, Cylinder, Sphere).

Description._LCLZText: Select an object or group of objects to replace. Select the desired simple shape to replace the object or objects. The default shape will bound all of the selected objects and the original objects are suppressed.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Fills gaps in surfaces and shells.
Improves geometry by filling gaps between selected object edges. Choose the Extend or Patch options appropriate for the gap.

Tips._LCLZText: Fills gaps in surfaces or shells with a new surface.

Description._LCLZText: The gap fill command can be used to replace surfaces that didn't import into Fusion 360 correctly, or to connect Midsurface shells. Choose between the different fill type operations to create a the desired new surface to fill a gap.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Derive design elements such as components, bodies, sketches, workgeometry, flat patterns or parameters from this design to another (new or existing) design.
The other design elements update with changes to this design.

Tips._LCLZText: Select objects in the browser or canvas to add to the list of derived objects. Selecting a Component will also include all objects in the component. Individual objects in a component can be excluded from the list by selecting then clicking the 'X'

TextBlock._LCLZText: Insert design elements such as components, bodies, sketches, workgeometry, flat patterns or parameters from another design.
The inserted elements update with changes to the original design.
Opens a design or drawing from your projects or local computer.
Select a design or drawing from the project browser and click Open, or click “Open from my computer” and select a supported file.
Capture Position
Captures the positions of recently moved/rotated components as an event in your timeline. This information is used by geometry and assemble commands.
Use this if you intend to continue modeling/assembling while keeping components at their current positions.
Returns the components to the previous position and rotation.
